hero.question: Will Bitcoin dip to $45,000 by December 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point drop to 53.5% suggests bears are loading up on recession hedges after hawkish Fed signals, betting a macro squeeze forces Bitcoin below $45K within 18 months. At even odds, you're getting paid for tail risk that requires a 2008-style credit event, but the market's ignoring that a $45K floor still keeps Bitcoin well above long-term cost of production around $30K.

daily_take.headline: Bitcoin's $45K Dip Question Just Got Cheaper. Time to Buy or Fade?
daily_take.deck: Bitcoin dip odds crashed 10 points in 24 hours, dropping to 53.5%. The move suggests either capitulation from dip-buyers or smart money smelling desperation. At better-than-even odds on a 2-year window, you're getting paid for volatility that hasn't happened yet. The play depends on your read of macro, but overshooting on the downside in liquid markets usually finds buyers before hitting hard levels.
